name: FUELS AMERICA
description: Promote benefits of renewable fuel and the Renewable Fuel Standard.
sampleDescriptions: Issues related to the Renewable Fuel Standard (RFS) including point of obligation, proposals to cap renewable identification number (RIN)s, proposals change octane standards, and H. R. 5212/S.2519 - the GREENER Fuels Act and S.517 - Consumer and Fuel Retailer Choice Act.

Issues related to the Renewable Fuel Standard (RFS) including point of obligation, proposals to cap renewable identification number (RIN)s, proposals change octane standards, and H. R. 5212/S.2519 - the GREENER Fuels Act and S.517 - Consumer and Fuel Retailer Choice Act, and discussion draft H.R. _ the 21st Century Transportation Fuels Act.

Issues related to the Renewable Fuel Standard (RFS) including, small refinery waivers, regulations regarding Reid vapor pressure (RVP), and proposals to regulate renewable identification numbers (RINs).

H. R. 3006, Renewable Fuel Standard Integrity Act of 2019 and S.1840, A bill to establish certain requirements for the small refineries exemption of the renewable fuels provisions under the Clean Air Act, and for other purposes.

Issues related to the role of biofuels in addressing climate change.  H.R. 6800, The Health and Economic Recovery Omnibus Emergency Solutions Act (HEROES Act), including relief for biofuels sector.

Issues related to tax credits impacting the biofuels industry, including H.R.4254/S.2262, the Low Carbon Biofuel Credit Act and S.2267, a bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a tax credit for the production of flexible fuel vehicles, and to amend title 49, United States Code to restore certain flexible fuel vehicle credits.

Issues related to the deployment of fueling infrastructure for higher blends of biofuels. Issues related to Biofuel Infrastructure and Agricultural Product Market Expansion Act.  Issues related to the deployment of fueling infrastructure for higher blends of biofuels in the FY2022 budget reconciliation process.

Issues related to tax credits impacting the biofuels industry, including H.R.4254/S.2262, the Low Carbon Biofuel Credit Act and S.2267, a bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a tax credit for the production of flexible fuel vehicles, and to amend title 49, United States Code to restore certain flexible fuel vehicle credits, and issues related to extending the biodiesel tax credit, and providing incentives for the deployment of biofuels as part of the FY2022 budget reconciliation process.  Issues related to sustainable aviation fuel (SAF), including H.R. 3440/S.2263, the Sustainable Skies Act and SAF  provisions in the FY 2022 budget reconciliation process.
